'Gramicidin' is a heterogeneous mixture of six antibiotic compounds,
'gramicidins A', 'B' and 'C', making up 80%, 6%, and 14% respectively, A. S.
Bourinbaiar and C. F. Coleman Arch Virol (1997) '142': 2225-2235 all of
which are obtained from the soil bacterial species [[Bacillus brevis]] and
called collectively 'gramicidin D'. Gramicidin D are linear pentadecapeptides;
that is chains made up of 15 amino acids. Biopolymers (Peptide Science),
Vol. 51, 129â144 (1999): http://www3.interscience.wiley.com/cgi-
bin/abstract/62500357/ABSTRACT  This is in contrast to gramicidin S which
is a cyclic peptide chain.
